all_questions.question: What is the goal of modifying the grammatical constructions in the machine translation system?
all_questions.context: So we need to extract more rules. We need to make sure that the hierarchical or syntactic system is not any weaker in covering the input sentences than the phrase-based system.

all_questions.question: What type of inputs does the machine translation system want to handle?
all_questions.context: We do not want our machine translation system to require only valid inputs. We want to be robust and to handle also partly wrong inputs.

all_questions.question: How will the syntactic system be modified to handle grammatically incorrect sentences?
all_questions.context: So in other words, you would like the syntactic system to also digest grammatically incorrect sentences.

all_questions.question: What is the effect of binarizing grammatical constructions on the alignment of the machine translation system?
all_questions.context: So every production that has more elements than two will be converted to a sequence of binary productions and that will give you more points where your alignments can match with these subparts.

all_questions.question: Why are some binarization steps not well motivated from the linguistic point of view?
all_questions.context: Some of these binarization steps are not well motivated from the linguistic point of view.
